issue.title: Upgrade Classic McEliece to NIST round 4 specification
issue.body:
Hi! Are there any plans to upgrade the Classic McEliece KEM to the [round 4 specification](https://classic.mceliece.org/nist.html)?

The Rust implementation `classic-mceliece-rust` is doing that here: https://github.com/Colfenor/classic-mceliece-rust/pull/33

issue.title: Remove rainbow
issue.body:
Removes the rainbow signature scheme as per https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/issues/1317. I'll submit a PR per algorithm since removing each one is not totally mechanical and straightforward. Once all the algorithms are removed I'll move on to the downstream projects.

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [x] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider), [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

comment.body: I did, perhaps by the time the other algorithms are removed this will have been merged in.

issue.title: [WIP] Sync with upstream
issue.body:
🚨 WIP - DO NOT MERGE 🚨

---

Update to commit [f0518d](https://github.com/google/boringssl/commit/f0518d45119dd4dd322a884669daf8247bc3c992).

**Note:** Some tests still fail, see output of `ninja run_tests` below.

Compiled on Apple silicon (ARM), macOS 13.0.

FYI, compilation for x86 works the same, to do so on an M1/M2 Mac - add to `CMakeLists.txt` (both to BSSL and `liboqs`):

```
SET(CMAKE_OSX_ARCHITECTURES "x86_64" CACHE INTERNAL "" FORCE)
SET(CMAKE_OSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET "10.13.0" CACHE INTERNAL "" FORCE)
```

<details>
<summary>Output of `ninja run_tests`</summary>

comment.body: Builds and successfully passes the tests for me.

> Builds and successfully passes the tests for me.

Need to try this out again, seems to fail on my Windows machine as well. Will update (and fix the CI so that we can look at what CircleCI says :)).
